alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Kershaw; Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 6:50PM EDT until August 07 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Lee County in central South Carolina... Chesterfield County in central South Carolina... North central Sumter County in central South Carolina... Southeastern Kershaw County in central South Carolina... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 649 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sturdivants to near Liberty Hill, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Cheraw, Bishopville, Chesterfield, Cheraw State Park, Northeastern Technical College, Elliott, Cheraw Municipal Airport, Lee State Park, Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge, Mcbee, Ruby, Patrick, Bethune, Lucknow, Chesterfield Ruby Middle School, Manville, Cheraw Fish Hatchery, Spring Hill, Middendorf, and Woodrow. This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 103 and 126. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
